title: Quarterly Acquisitions and Disposals of Capital Assets Survey
legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.

list: Provide data for business activity in England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland and the UK Continental Shelf. Exclude the Channel Islands and Isle of Man.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures aren’t available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: You can select the dates of the period you are reporting for, if the given dates are not appropriate.
Read the detailed guidance for completing this survey

questions.question: Total capital expenditure on major improvements and construction work

content.title: Include
list: Newly built, major refurbishments or improvements to existing buildings, for own use, or where you are responsible for maintenance.
Work contracted to constructors or arranged through agents or developers.
Non-residential buildings, for example, public monuments, commercial, industrial, educational and health buildings.
Fittings and installations such as lifts, electrics, plumbing, heating and ventilation systems and water supply.
Construction of structures such as oil wells, platforms, mines, pipes, power lines, transport infrastructure, wind farms, turbines and steel frameworks.
Site improvements and other land preparation for own use, for example, levelling, clearance and draining of marshes.
Transfer costs, stamp duties and taxes payable to acquire the asset.
All professional charges such as legal costs, agents’ commission, and architects’, engineers’, and surveyors’ fees.

content.title: Exclude
list: Expenditure on land purchased in connection with construction work.
Structures that are used primarily as residences (dwellings) including houses, houseboats, caravans, and associated structures such as garages.
Machinery and equipment - report this in the next section.
Purchase of existing structures such as oil wells, platforms, mines, pipes, power lines, transport infrastructure, wind farms, turbines and steel frameworks.

definitions.title: What constitutes major improvements and construction work?

list: Newly built, major refurbishments or improvements to existing buildings, for own use, or where you are responsible for maintenance.
Work contracted to constructors or arranged through agents or developers.
Non-residential buildings, for example, public monuments, commercial, industrial, educational and health buildings.
Fittings and installations such as lifts, electrics, plumbing, heating and ventilation systems and water supply.
Construction of structures such as oil wells, platforms, mines, pipes, power lines, transport infrastructure, wind farms, turbines and steel frameworks.
Site improvements and other land preparation for own use, for example, levelling, clearance and draining of marshes.
Transfer costs, stamp duties and taxes payable to acquire the asset.
All professional charges such as legal costs, agents’ commission, and architects’, engineers’, and surveyors’ fees.
Expenditure on land purchased in connection with construction work.
Structures that are used primarily as residences (dwellings) including houses, houseboats, caravans, and associated structures such as garages.
Machinery and equipment - report this in the next section.
Purchase of existing structures such as oil wells, platforms, mines, pipes, power lines, transport infrastructure, wind farms, turbines and steel frameworks.
